document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Yuan, Feng, Ascher, John S., Kasparek, Max, Orr, Michael C., Griswold, Terry & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.docTitle: Anthidium (Proanthidium) qingtaoi Niu & Zhu 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

heading.emphasis:
Anthidium ( Proanthidium ) qingtaoi Niu & Zhu
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Fig. 39 a–j, male; Fig. 40 a–h, female)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 39.
Anthidium ( Proanthidium ) qingtaoi Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.
. Male. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Flagellum in ventral view; d (d-1): Mesosoma in dorsal view, d-1 showing the scutellum with narrow yellow apical margin; e: Metasoma in dorsal view; f: T5–T7 in dorsal view; g: S5–S6 in ventral view; h: S8 in ventral view; i: Genitalia in dorsal view; j: Hind trochanter in ventral view, showing the subapical inside projection. Scale bars: 1 mm.

FIGURE 40.
Anthidium ( Proanthidium ) qingtaoi Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.
. Female. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Clypeus in frontal view; d: Mandible in lateral view; e: Flagellum in ventral view; f: Mesosoma in dorsal view; g: Metasoma in dorsal view; g (g-1): T4–T6 in dorsal view, g-1 showing the yellow band on T6 not interrupted medially. Scale bars: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material:
Holotype , ♂ , China , Xizan : Zanda Xian , ( 31º29′N , 79º47′E ),
3680 m
,
25.VII.2018
, leg. Qing- Tao Wu
; Paratypes : 28 ♂ , 23 ♀ , same label information as the holotype ,
3 ♂ ,
15.VIII.2019
, leg. Qing-Tao Wu & Dan ZHANG ; Zanda Xian , Xiangzi town , Xixie village ( 31º46′N , 79º30′E ),
4023 m
,
6 ♂ , 1 ♀ ,
15.VIII.2019
, leg. Qing- Tao WU & Dan ZHANG ; Pulan Xian , Pulan Town , Chide village ( 30º17′N , 81º08′E ),
3943 m
,
1 ♂ ,
13.VIII.2019
, leg. Qing-Tao WU & Dan ZHANG
.
Etymology : The specific name is dedicated to Mr. Qing-Tao WU who collected the holotype .

Remarks: If
A. luteiventre Friese
is a synonym of
A . trochantericum
as claimed by Zanden (1995) , in addition to color differences presented in the diagnosis,
A. qingtaoi
differs from
A. trochantericum
in the longer spine of the hind trochanter based on study of the
A. luteiventre
type .
Anthidium qingtaoi
appears to be closely related to
A. kvakicum Mavromoustakis
from Tajikistan . Based on the description it appears to differ from
A. kvakicum
by reduced yellow markings including the absence of an L-shaped yellow stripe laterally and posteriorly on the scutum and the yellow marking of the vertex broadly interrupted. Unfortunately, no mention is made of the hind trochanter in the description.
